docs.lead_paragraph: Since the birth of their daughter six years ago, Jake and Sarina Roher have moved four times, bouncing from Oregon to California, back to Oregon and then again to California. Early this year, they tossed up here in the Sierra Nevada, on the south shore of Lake Tahoe. They would love to stay in this resort community where their daughter, Shalayah, is thriving in school. But they will move again.

headline.main: A Place Without Roots That Some Call Home

docs.abstract: 2000 census shows casino and ski community of Stateline, Nev, is most rootless place in America, with only 4.5 percent of its 1,146 residents born in Nevada; shows Nevada is by far most transient state, and Las Vegas most transient major city; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Over the past decade, the percentage of high school students who say they are virgins has risen significantly, according to a report published on Friday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Last year, the report found, high school virgins outnumbered those who had engaged in sexual intercourse, 54 percent to 46 percent. A decade earlier, the percentages were the opposite.

headline.main: More in High School Are Virgins, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report shows percentage of high school students who say they are virgins has risen significantly over last decade; finds high school virgins outnumber those who engaged in sexual intercourse, 54 percent to 46 percent; percentages were opposite decade earlier; 57.9 percent of sexually active students say they used condoms when they last had intercourse, up from 46.2 percent decade earlier; Laura Kann, one of authors of report, comments (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: I am usually in sync with the Ethicist, but I disagree with his disapproving response to the husband who kept a friend's pregnancy a secret from his wife (Sept. 15). In 12 years of marriage, I have kept word of other people's pregnancies, abortions, new ventures and old surgeries from my husband, as I was asked to, because they involved others and not us. I would imagine that he has done the same under our legal but unregulated contract. A married couple need not fully disclose all information all the time -- unless, of course, the baby in question is hers or his. Raleigh Mayer New York
docs.abstract: Raleigh Mayer letter disagrees with Ethicist's September 15 response to husband who kept friend's pregnancy secret from his wife
